      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Tree TreePLEService.createTree(java.lang.String aSpecies, java.sql.Date aDate, int aId, Person aPerson, Location aLocation)
      This method is the short version for adding a tree in the system when it has been planted This was created for developers to facilitate the implementation and testing One feature of this method, is that a client can write a species name with Capitals or spaces and will look into the file if this trees can grow on the lands of Canada
      Tree TreePLEService.createTree(java.lang.String aSpecies, float aHeight, int aAge, java.sql.Date aDate, float aDiameter, int aId, Person aPerson, Location aLocation)
      This method is to successfully plant a tree in the system
      java.util.List<Tree> TreePLEService.findAllTrees()
      This method lists ALL the trees registered in the TreePLE System
      java.util.List<Tree> TreePLEService.getAllTreesBySpecies(java.lang.String species)
      This method searches for trees that belongs to the same species
      java.util.List<Tree> TreePLEService.getTreesByArea(float lat, float lon, float radius)
      This method searches for trees that is within a specific area (circular) with center at the location specified by longitude and latitude
      java.util.List<Tree> TreePLEService.getTreesByMunicipality(java.lang.String municipality)
      This method searches for trees that is within a specified municipality
      java.lang.String TreePLEService.login(java.lang.String email, java.lang.String password)
      This method that checks if a user is already registered in the system and can access by logging in the system.
